intro: Knautia prostii, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and rocky areas, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Knautia prostii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
